Subsetting and subassignment

Source: vignettes/subassign.Rmd
subassign.Rmd
library(tibble)

This vignette is an attempt to provide a comprehensive overview over all subsetting and subassignment operations, highlighting where the tibble implementation differs from the data frame implementation.

new_df <- function() {
  df <- data.frame(a = 1:3, b = letters[4:6])
  df$c <- list(7, 8:9, 10:12)
  df
}

new_tbl <- function() {
  tibble(a = 1:3, b = letters[4:6], c = list(7, 8:9, 10:12))
}
new_df()
#>   a b          c
#> 1 1 d          7
#> 2 2 e       8, 9
#> 3 3 f 10, 11, 12
 
new_tbl()
#> # A tibble: 3 x 3
#>       a b     c        
#>   <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 d     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 e     <int [2]>
#> 3     3 f     <int [3]>

Subsetting

$

With $ subsetting, accessing a missing column gives a warning:

df <- new_df()
 
tbl <- new_tbl()
 
df$a
#> [1] 1 2 3
 
tbl$a
#> [1] 1 2 3
 
df$"a"
#> [1] 1 2 3
 
tbl$"a"
#> [1] 1 2 3
 
df$a[2:3]
#> [1] 2 3
 
tbl$a[2:3]
#> [1] 2 3
 
df$d
#> NULL
 
tbl$d
#> Warning: Unknown or uninitialised
#> column: 'd'.
#> NULL

[

With [ subsetting, tibbles always return a tibble. The drop argument is supported but has different defaults:

df <- new_df()
 
tbl <- new_tbl()
 
df["a"]
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
 
tbl["a"]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
 
df["a", drop = FALSE]
#> Warning in `[.data.frame`(df, "a",
#> drop = FALSE): 'drop' argument will be
#> ignored
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
 
tbl["a", drop = FALSE]
#> Warning: drop ignored
#> # A tibble: 3 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
 
df["a", drop = TRUE]
#> Warning in `[.data.frame`(df, "a", drop
#> = TRUE): 'drop' argument will be ignored
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
 
tbl["a", drop = TRUE]
#> Warning: drop ignored
#> # A tibble: 3 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
 
df[, "a"]
#> [1] 1 2 3
 
tbl[, "a"]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
 
df[, "a", drop = FALSE]
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
#> 3 3
 
tbl[, "a", drop = FALSE]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
#> 3     3
 
df[, "a", drop = TRUE]
#> [1] 1 2 3
 
tbl[, "a", drop = TRUE]
#> [1] 1 2 3
 
df[c("a", "b")]
#>   a b
#> 1 1 d
#> 2 2 e
#> 3 3 f
 
tbl[c("a", "b")]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 2
#>       a b    
#> * <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 d    
#> 2     2 e    
#> 3     3 f
 
df[, c("a", "b")]
#>   a b
#> 1 1 d
#> 2 2 e
#> 3 3 f
 
tbl[, c("a", "b")]
#> # A tibble: 3 x 2
#>       a b    
#> * <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 d    
#> 2     2 e    
#> 3     3 f
 
df[1, ]
#>   a b c
#> 1 1 d 7
 
tbl[1, ]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 3
#>       a b     c        
#> * <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 d     <dbl [1]>
 
df[1:2, ]
#>   a b    c
#> 1 1 d    7
#> 2 2 e 8, 9
 
tbl[1:2, ]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 3
#>       a b     c        
#> * <int> <chr> <list>   
#> 1     1 d     <dbl [1]>
#> 2     2 e     <int [2]>
 
df[1, "a"]
#> [1] 1
 
tbl[1, "a"]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
 
df[1, "a", drop = FALSE]
#>   a
#> 1 1
 
tbl[1, "a", drop = FALSE]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
 
df[1:2, "a"]
#> [1] 1 2
 
tbl[1:2, "a"]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
 
df[1:2, "a", drop = FALSE]
#>   a
#> 1 1
#> 2 2
 
tbl[1:2, "a", drop = FALSE]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 1
#>       a
#> * <int>
#> 1     1
#> 2     2
 
df[1, c("a", "b")]
#>   a b
#> 1 1 d
 
tbl[1, c("a", "b")]
#> # A tibble: 1 x 2
#>       a b    
#> * <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 d
 
df[1:2, c("a", "b")]
#>   a b
#> 1 1 d
#> 2 2 e
 
tbl[1:2, c("a", "b")]
#> # A tibble: 2 x 2
#>       a b    
#> * <int> <chr>
#> 1     1 d    
#> 2     2 e

[[
